### Now it’s your turn to contemplate Gate 20

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of gate 20 are always available to you(whether it’s defined in your chart or not)

Title: Human Design Gate 21 – Gene Key 21 – The Resource Manager
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 21 isThe Gate of Hunter/Huntress. But I call itThe Resource Managerbecause its primary action is to respect and understand the value of community resources-time, money, energy, and people (including yourself)- and manage them with integrity.

## About Human Design Gate 21 – Gene Key 21

Archetype Name:The Resource Manager

In Action:understand, value, and respect all resources

Keywords:control, taking charge, and managing resources

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Hunter/Huntress

Human Design Definition:The justified and necessary use of power in overcoming deliberate and persistent interference.

Core Theme:To be in control of circumstances.

Bodygraph Center:Will center and connects to the Throat center viahuman design gate 45.

Tropical Sign:Aries

Gene Keys Shadow:Control

Gene Keys Gift:Authority

Gene Keys Siddhi:Valor

​​(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate21

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 21 is the energy for understanding, respecting, and valuing all resources. For gate 21, energy management is all about balancing yin and yang, masculine and feminine, push and pull. In this way, gate 21 easily manages the mundane resources of its family, community, or company in a way that empowers everyone.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 21 is the energy for controlling others to appease your ego, fearing your own power and authority, or feelings of low self-worth due to people-pleasing.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling submissive, rebellious or domineering but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 21 (Gene Key 21)

Gate 21 is undefined in my chart.

But my husband has it defined in the unconscious sun of hisincarnation cross. And learning that shocked me (gate 51 in my conscious earth!).

I can usually sense the gates in someone’s chart from a mile away. But, in my experience, “controlling” and my husband just did not go together.

In his everyday demeanor, he is incredibly respectful of every living thing he encounters (gate 19!). He has never tried to control me in any way, shape, or form. And he definitely isn’t the stereotypical picture of someone who tries to control the world.

So, it truly baffled me (and made me check my ego!) that he has gate 21 as such a prominent placement.

Similar to my initial feelings about the “salesman” ofgate 26, I was full of negative judgment about what it really means to be a person with gate 21 defined.

As all judgments do, this pointed me to my shadows with gate 21 and the “controlling” parts of myself that I’ve often rejected.

With my Aries rising + my conscious Earth, I’ve often been called domineering, headstrong, and pushy. To be honest, I’ve often chalked this up to being “about them” and not at all about me. 🤣

But, when I look more closely at some of the taboo shadows of gate 21 – control freak, rebel, passive-aggressive – I see myself written all over it.

(I cover the golden and taboo shadows for the gates of your cross in theHuman Design Map.)

I’m human. When my life is out of control, I tend to try to control the world around me. I am not immune to thinking that if other people change, if circumstances were different, or everything is in its “right” place, all would be well with the world.

As I’ve explored and integrated those shadows, I gained access to the full spectrum of energy potential in gate 21. And, because it can only work that way, my husband came into clearer view.

I saw his list of every single thing in the freezer.

I appreciated how he makes impossible things fit in a suitcase and pack the car when we travel.

I noticed how well he manages money and his natural ability to rein in the stuff of life.

And then I had a nice little chuckle because I remembered that his job title is Fixed Asset Manager. He literally gets paid to manage resources.

What?!?!?!

Color me shocked. How did I miss that?

I missed it because I was in judgment of anyone who comes across as controlling. And I was in judgment because I was rejecting those parts of myself.

What I teach people inside theirHuman Design Mapreally is true.

Every gate (line, center, channel, etc.) in the chart holds a spectrum of energy potential. It is our judgments, of ourselves and others, that keep us from accessing all of it.

But when we open our hearts and face the truth of our wholeness, we access our greatest potential.

It is literally all right there in the chart. Even in the gates we think are terrible.

Title: Human Design Gate 22 – Gene Key 22 – The Graceful Gaze
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 22 isThe Gate of Openness. But I call itThe Graceful Gazebecause its primary action is to offer grace and compassion, to yourself and others, in the presence of pain and suffering, especially in shame.

## About Human Design Gate 22 – Gene Key 22

Archetype Name:The Graceful Gaze

In Action:offer Grace to yourself and others

Keywords:grace, beauty, and emotional understanding

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Openness

Human Design Definition:A quality of behavior best suited in handling mundane and trivial situations.

Core Theme:Fear of Silence.

Bodygraph Center:Emotional Solar Plexus center and connects to the Throat center viahuman design gate 12.

Tropical Sign:Pisces

Gene Keys Shadow:Dishonor

Gene Keys Gift:Graciousness

Gene Keys Siddhi:Grace

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 22

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 22 is the energy for offering grace to yourself and others. Gate 22 understands that the full range of emotions, from the heights of ecstatic bliss to the dirtiest darkest pits of shame, are simply human. Because of this understanding, Gate 22 is able to see the whole world as an astounding place of beauty, abundance, and love.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 22 is the energy for believing that you do not deserve the beauty, love, or grace in your life. It represses emotions, lives from a place of emotional reactivity and ignores responsibility for it’s emotions through blame, victimization, and finding fault.

IMPORTANT NOTE:It’s crucial to understand that “positive” and “negative” are not intended as moral judgments; they are tools of awareness to support you on your Human Design journey — the journey of radical self-acceptance and bold purpose.

Your Human Design is never to be used as a weapon against yourself or as evidence that you are broken, unlovable, or any other bullshit that blocks your radiance.

If you see yourself on the “negative” side of {gate 22}, please be kind to yourself. This is an opportunity to BE the Love and Grace you so deeply crave (we all so deeply crave!).

When you notice yourself struggling with feeling graceless, “too” emotional or unforgiving, use it as a sign to cultivate curiosity and as a path to a more expanded self-concept.

By adopting this more compassionate way of seeing your “negative” qualities and experiences, you will automatically expand into your chart’s higher and higher potentials. Minus the toxic positivity or gaslighting yourself.

Simply put…

Your ability to embody your chart’s “highest” potential is directly proportional to your ability to unconditionally love your chart’s “lowest” potential. You cannot hate your way to Love and Grace.

This is at the heart of what you will learn in the MAP Method for Deconditioning, my signature course included with your Human Design Map (made just for you) & Portal.Get yours here.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling reactive, awkward or mean but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design Gate 22 (Gene Key 22)

Oh, Gate 22, how do I love thee? Let me count the ways.

I could write endless books about my experiences and love of Gate 22.

The energy of Grace has been such a significant part of my life.

Gate 22 is undefined in my chart, but my husband has the entire 12-22 channel.

(I dive deeply into all 36 channels inside theHuman Design Map portal.)

From a Gene Keys perspective, my husband’s attraction sphere is gate 22, and I am confident that our meeting wasFierce Gracein action.

Then I laid my eyes on him for the first time; I knew that our rivers were meeting for a reason.

We had some beautiful mirror work to do together.

I was raised in a religious culture that perpetuated really toxic ideas about Grace. Things like Grace, Mercy, and God’s Love were used as weapons to control others and ensure that “the top” stayed at the top.

I spent many years rebelling against any idea that even came close to the “Grace” of my upbringing.

But that all changed shortly after meeting my husband.

My husband isn’t a “spiritual” kind of guy. At the beginning of our relationship, I asked him what he thinks about God, and he literally said, “I don’t.”

But he embodies Grace on a level that I can’t even describe.

Even in my absolutely “ugliest” moments, there is never a single doubt of his unconditional love.

He doesn’t use my “negative” states against me or as tools for manipulation.

He is deeply present with all of me – in my shadow and in my light.

I can honestly say that I’d never experienced that with a human being before him.

He opened me up to heal the wounds of toxic religion and energetically showed me how to receive the Fiercest Grace of all – the Grace of the Divine.

Shortly after we were married, I went to a Baron Baptiste yoga workshop in Dallas, Texas. I was in yoga teacher training, and he was all the rage in the vinyasa yoga scene.

So much so that I paid hundreds of dollars and flew over 1000 miles to practice yoga with himfor four hours.

And it was an experience I will never forget.

There were hundreds of people, and we were mat to mat. Our sweat literally dripped on one another as we pushed through the incredible limits of our minds.

He guided us through 3.5 hours of vinyasa, ending with a very long savasana.

Krishna Das was blaring on the speakers.

“My foolish heart

Why do you weep?

You throw yourself away again

Now you cry yourself to sleep.

Cry yourself to sleep…

My foolish heart

When will you learn?

You are the eyes of the world

And there’s nowhere else to turn.

Nowhere else to turn…”

Krishna Das, My Foolish Heart, Heart as Wide as the World

There I was, my body completely vulnerable, sweat drying into a gritty mess on my skin, and deep, snotty sobs pouring out of me. Surrounded by hundreds of strangers.

There was no fear of judgment. There was no worry about what others were thinking of me. No part of me believed that I shouldn’t be sobbing like that.

But more importantly, there was this deep knowing that all of me was welcome.

My body knew that I am loved without condition.

No hoops. No hierarchies. No lovable and unlovable.

It was Grace. It is all Grace.

I’ve had endless experiences of Grace since then.

And, from this open place, I can even see the slivers of Grace in my early, though quite traumatic, childhood and early adulthood.

But this was the moment that made me aware that Grace is everywhere.

As I said, it is a moment I will never forget.

And it is that moment that I want to channel in everything I do.

Writing this post. Supporting my clients inside theHuman Design Map portal. Going to the grocery store.

Fierce Grace in action.

Title: Human Design Gate 23 – Gene Key 23 – The Alchemical Wordsmith
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 23 isThe Gate of Assimilation. But I call itThe Alchemical Wordsmithbecause its primary action is to communicate radical ideas and be recognized for your ability to initiate transformation with your words alone.

## About Human Design Gate 23 – Gene Key 23

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 23

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 23 is the energy for using your voice to communicate radical ideas and to become recognized for your ability to initiate transformation with your words alone.With gate 23 defined, you are likely to be known for getting to the point, simplifying complex ideas, and not wasting precious time or energy by babbling on about things that do not serve the end goal.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 23 is the energy of holding back out of fear that you are too weird, worrying that people don’t care what you have to say because you are “too out there.” When feeling unrecognized, you might even tend to talk “at” people who aren’t ready to listeninstead of trusting that there are people who want to hear what you have to say.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are trying to force others to “get you” but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 23 (Gene Key 23)

Gate 23 is undefined in my chart, but it is a pretty significant because it is one of the gates that will bridge my small split.

Withgate 62,gate 43, andgate 56hanging, I have a small split between my ajna and throat.

So, Gate 23 is one of the gates that would bridge that split.

One of the common experiences with hanging gates, especially when they hang in a significant spot in the chart like mine, is that we can experience feelings of inadequacy in the undefined gate.

As I always say, where we are defined, we often feel like we are “too much,” and where we are undefined, we can feel like we are “not enough.” And gates that bridge splits are like fuel on that fire.

(I discuss the effect of hanging gates, splits, and channels more inside theHuman Design Map & Portal.)

That “not enough” voice was loud and clear when I first wrote my personal contemplation of Gate 23.

That was in 2022, and I was writing the gates articles on a schedule that put me a little ahead of when the sun would transit each ofthe 64 Human Design Gates.

One of the themes that began to unfold was that my life would start to reflect the gate somehow and layers of conditioning were peeling away.

And, true to form, that happened with Gate 23, but in a really profound way. With the gates I’d written before, my life was showing me. But in this case, it was the actual process of writing.

As I stared at the screen before me, I racked my brain for something profound to say. I really wanted to blow your mind with some sort of radical insight.

I started scanning for quantum leaps.What have I said to someone that triggered a quantum leap for them? What had someone said to me that completely blew my mind? What quantumn leaps was I seeing in the world around me?

Then, I thought about the people with gate 23 that I’ve guided. I thought about one of my coaches with Gate 23 defined. I thought about friends or people I follow online.

I even started mentally making a list of “profound” statements I could share.

And, like a lightning bolt, I saw clearly what my conditioned mind was doing.

My mind was trying to compensate for my perceived inadequacy. It was telling me a story that, because this was gate 23 it must be profound and earth-shattering. I had convinced myself that if it didn’t trigger a quantum leap for whoever read it, it was a worthless piece of trash.

Good times. And so hilarious to me now.  How cute of my brain.

As I saw what was happening, I was able to surrender.

Gate 23 doesn’t “make” quantum leaps happen by “trying.” It happens spontaneously, through Divine Timing. And Divine Timing rarely matches our stories about timing.

When we look at the mechanics of the chart, we can see that from the head to the ajna, we can’t force the ajna to produce insight – we just have to sit with the questions and allow insight to arrive.

And from the ajna to the throat, we can’t force the “right” words to come out or make others receive our words. All of that is left to the mystery of synchronicity.

And what Gate 23 shows us is that a captive audience is part of the synchronicity. Like allprojected energy, it is dependent on the receptivity of the people listening.

So, even if I say the most brilliant shit ever and you aren’t receptive to it, it will not land as a quantum leap. And I can say the most mundane shit ever but it be the exact thing you needed to hear to catapult into your next iteration.

It is like a square peg, round hole scenario.

Forcing it won’t work. Because it does not work that way.

I am grateful for what Gate 23 showed me that day. I am more aware of when I am trying to conjure profound words, instead of just letting them flow. I don’t need to carry the weight of that anymore.

By design, I will just keep attuning to my Gate 43 and let the mystery of Grace take care of the rest.

Pretty profound, no?

Title: Human Design Gate 24 – Gene Key 24 – The Silent Mystic
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 24 isThe Gate of Rationalization. But I call itThe Silent Mysticbecause its primary action is to transform mystical inspiration into rational thought through silence.

## About Human Design Gate 24 – Gene Key 24

Archetype Name:The Silent Mystic

In Action:create transformation through silence

Keywords:silence, wise rationalization, and mental renewal

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Rationalization

Human Design Definition:The natural and spontaneous process of transformation and renewal.

Core Theme:Fear of ignorance.

Bodygraph Center:Ajna center and connects to the Head center viahuman design gate 61.

Tropical Sign:Taurus

Gene Keys Shadow:Addiction

Gene Keys Gift:Invention

Gene Keys Siddhi:Silence

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 24

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 24 is the energy for wise rationalization and being in silence when needed. Gate 24 believes that silence really is golden and that pausing is sacred. It is able to bring through inspiration and transformation by mastering the subtle pause between giving and receiving.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 24 is the energy for avoiding silence with buffering or filling it with unnecessary noise.  It beats itself up or shames itself for needing to revisit ideas, over and over again, before they “click”. And struggling to find the balance between giving and receiving.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling ill-informed, misguided or anxious but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design Gate 24 (Gene Key 24)

The Channel of Awareness (61-24) is defined inmy human design chart, giving me a definedhead centerandajna center.Gate 61—mystery, inner truth, and divine knowing—is in my unconscious Earth and Gate 24 in my unconscious South Node.

When I first learned aboutGate 61, it was an immediate moment of clarity. I got it. Yes, absolutely—I’m a mystic and always have been. It took me a while to accept my mystic path, but I always knew it.

Gate 24, though, wasn’t an instant click (irony?). It’s often called the gate the addict, which I totally resonated with. I’ve struggled with all sorts of addiction in my life —drugs, alcohol, sex with strangers, food—the thing about silence wasn’t really clear, though.

It took years of lived experience—sobriety, self-inquiry, and prioritizingpure aura time—before I truly understood that silence isn’t just the absence of noise.

When the world around us is quiet, our thoughts get LOUD. And it can be uncomfortable AF.

In that discomfort, the voice of rationalization (addiction) rises up, as if its a savior on a white horse.

That became crystal clear to me one day while driving in silence (on of my favorite pure aura time practices). No music, no podcasts, no audiobooks.

Just me and my mind.

Suddenly, with pristine clarity, I heard the voice of addiction.

I was rationalizing making a harmful choice. Thoughts that, maybe even the day before, would have driven me straight into old patterns. They weren’t dramatic thoughts; they actually sounded quite reasonable:

- A little won’t hurt.

- Just make it easy on yourself.

- This time will be different; I can handle it.

But reason is flawed and true mysticism requires surrendering it.

And in that moment, I realized that my addictive voice sounded nothing like I’d assumed. It didn’t feel chaotic, out of control, or irrational. Instead, it was a calm, convincing voice that seemed so true.

But it wasn’t the truth; it was justifying one of the things that disconnects me from my inner truth. It was the snake in the Garden of Eden.

Had I been listening to a podcast, or book, or even my belovedTrevor Hall, I might not have even heard it. I would have been well on my way to the land of disconnection.

In the silence, though, Iheardthe loop.

And because I heard it, I had power over it. I did not have to believe it (aka act on it as if it was the Truth).

Instead, I just kept driving to my intended destination.

(Inside the​Human Design Map​, I guide you through the patterns in your chart that show up just like this—because when you can witness the story while it’s happening, you finally get to choose something different.)

That day, Gate 24 clicked for me in a whole new way. And my path with addiction changed.

Gate 24 was no longer just the “gate of the addict.” It was the voice of the mind trying to escape discomfort. It was the justifier. The sweet-talker. The one that makes running away from my inner world look like wisdom.

And more than anything, it was a reflection of how hard it can be tojust bewith ourselves when everything is quiet. To look inside and meet our maker. To receive the blessings of inner truth.

When we believe every thought, silence can feel like torture. When we’ve built our lives around productivity, pleasure, or people-pleasing, silence can feel like failure. When we don’t have the skills to be with ourselves, it can feel like the only thing left to do is drown our sorrows.

Some of us escape with substances. Others through work, scrolling, sex, overthinking, or staying busy all the time. But no matter the vice, the problem is the same: trying to avoid the discomfort that arises when we slow down enough to witness ourselves honestly.

We’re not taught how to do that. There’s no “Thought Loops 101” in school. No one teaches us how to sit in the gap between a thought and a choice.

But Gate 24 shows us that space. And that’s where our power returns.

(If you’re learning how to discern the difference between your truth and your mental conditioning, your chart will show you exactly where to look. That’s what I teach in the​Human Design Map & Portal​.)

Obviously, I can’t say with certainty that I’ll never revisit old behaviors. The loop still runs sometimes. The temptation to escape still shows up.

But I’m onto myself now.

You can’t un-hear these thoughts once you recognize them for what they are. Addiction. Avoidance. Rationalization.

But when you make the space to be with yourself, in the silence, you can’t unsee your power, either.

And it is that remembering that is the magick.

That’s why I created the​Human Design Map​—not as a rulebook or magic pill, but as a mirror. A compassionate tool for helping you recognize the patterns, the loops, and the moments where you finally have the choice to return to yourself.

If you’ve been caught in the loop between knowing your truth but not living it, I can help you navigate the way.​👉 Click here to get your Human Design Map & Portal​.

Title: Human Design Gate 25 – Gene Key 25 – The Loving Soul
Content:

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 25

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 25 is the energy for unconditional love. Gate 25 believes that God is unconditional love and that every person on the planet is worthy of it. It knows that love conquers all and that the true path to unconditional love is acceptance of what is.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 25 is the energy for judging yourself and others. Gate 25 may experience a lot ofself-rejection, self-hatred, and self-loathing and mayshut down when trauma leaves an impression of being unworthy of love.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling shut down, ignorant, or closed off but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 25 (Gene Key 25)

Gate 25 is undefined in my chart. Butgate 51, which is the other side of the channel of initiation with gate 25, is defined in my conscious earth.

Our conscious earth is the energy that keeps us grounded and gives us the foundation necessary to surrender to our soul’s purpose (the conscious sun).

My conscious sun is in gate 57, meaning my soul’s purpose is to prioritize intuitive clarity above all else.

And the foundation I need in place to do that is the attitude of awakening that comes from the highest frequency of gate 51.

(I deep dive into your conscious sun + earth + all 36 channels + more in theHuman Design Map.)

Gate 51 is the gate of shock. And that shock can make us bitter, resentful, and unconscious in our lives.

On the other hand, shock can facilitate opening up to higher planes of consciousness and spiritual awareness.

But it isn’t the shock itself that does that.

What cracks our heart wide open is the revelation that Unconditional Love is the very fabric of the Universe.

So many of us have been conditioned to believe that Love is conditional. We have been taught that we have to jump through hoops to be lovable, worthy, and whole.

In that conditioning, we forget that we are the Divine Incarnate. We let it slip from our awareness that we are Love in action. We turn our back on the Grace, Compassion, Forgiveness, and Acceptance that is available to us in every moment.

Even a tiny glimpse of those things can be shocking when we are trapped in the illusion of being separated from the Divine.

But in those glimpses, we remember.

We call back the seeds of Truth and we reorient ourselves to the never ending practice of Unconditional Love. For ourselves, for others, for the things that happen, for the state of the world.

And it isn’t exactly easy. If it were easy, everyone would do it, right?

But what I know for sure is that it’s worth it. The ripple effect is worth it. The work of not turning against ourselves, and others, is worth it.

If you want a guide as you practice Unconditional Love, invite me in theHuman Design Map.

## The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 26

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On one end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 26 is the energy for being a champion for dreams that come true. Because the 26 trusts in the abundance of life, it is empowered to sell a brighter future to their tribewith integrity.

On the other end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 26 is the energy to manipulate or control others for its own gain.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling fear driven, selfish or shameful but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

## My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 26 (Gene Key 26)

Gate 26 isundefinedin my chart but I do havehuman design gate 44hanging in my (heavily) definedhuman design spleen center.

And when I was first contemplating gate 26 in my own life, I immediately thought of a sleazy used car salesman. I also noticed that a lot of the traditional Human Design information seemed only to reiterate that “negative” image.

The sleazy car salesperson will do and sayanythingto get the sale. They follow you around the lot and try to convince you that a Pinto is a Rolls Royce.

That was definitely the original image that was building in my mind and I noticed incredible amounts of resistance building up inside of me. Which, in so many cases, is a signal that there is ashadowready to be transformed into valuable purpose.

So, in noticing the resistance, I reflected on what it has been like learning sales and marketing as a business owner and creator of theHuman Design Map.

Though I have only been selling themapsince 2020, I have been in business since 2009. And true to my Midheaven being inhuman design gate 54, I quickly realized that sales and marketing would be part of my life almost every single day.

Before I was in business, I deeply believed that “being spiritual” and making money were opposed to one another. I was raised in a toxic religion and under the weight of patriarchal systems of oppression.

In those first years in business, something became crystal clear, though.

Without sales and marketing, I don’t make money. And if I don’t make money, I can’t pay my mortgage, buy groceries, or stock my bookshelves. 🙂

As I began to awaken to material success being a valid spiritual path (54), I realized that I’d need to overcome my negative connotations with sales and develop it as a skill that I am confident in.

I’ve come a long way with it, for sure, and by no means did I think I was done with my growth in this area. It seems I am always learning from the mistakes of the past (44) and figuring out what really works for me and myprojector aura.

But, even with well over a decade of that journey under my belt, I wasn’t expecting that contemplating gate 26 would be so healing for me.

And, whether sales are a regular part of your life or not, I think that what I learned could be an important lesson for you, too.

By now, it is probably clear AF that my relationship with the Divine is important to me.Human Design Gate 61in my unconscious earth means that I am a mystic. I am spiritually grounded and connected by having direct experience of the Divine and finding the golden thread among all paths to “God.”

And I have grown a lot from my religious upbringing.

I never really resonated with the churches I was raised in, and I abandoned those beliefs in my late teens.

By my early twenties, I had made my way into a life of drugs, alcohol, and sex with strangers.

That whole decade is basically a blur until my brother died shortly after my 28th birthday (aka first Saturn Return). It was the first of many spiritual awakenings that led me to where I am today (which honestly cannot easily be defined with words).

(If you are one of mymapclients, be sure to check out the quick and dirty guide on Planetary Seasons in themapportal.)

A couple years after I came out of my Saturn Return, I was introduced toRichard Rohrand one of his most popular books,Falling Upward.

The book’s premise is that in the first spiritual phase of our lives, we rely on other people to tell us who God is and tell us what to do to get into God’s Good Graces.

And, in the second spiritual phase of our lives, we begin to open up to our own understanding of God. It becomes a personal relationship instead of a dictated one.

In the book, he offers his personal insights about the possibilities of what that could be.

But, more importantly than that, he talks about the difference betweencollapsing our definition of Godorexpanding it.

He posits that when we face challenges in our lives, we tend to make our definition of God smaller. And that the very impulse to “collapse” God is an invitation to expand your definition of God.

In other words, if your definition of God isn’t big enough to hold whatever you are going through, it means you need to make your definition of God bigger.

This completely blew my mind. I can vividly remember storming out of my parent’s house at the age of 18, telling them that I didn’t believe in God.

I had certainly made my definition of God smaller. I could not reconcile my lived experience with that old definition of God.

So, when I read that book, I made a promise to myself that I was willing to reckon with my definition of God and the beliefs about the world that I hold dear. And that if my beliefs couldn’t reconcile out, I’d make God even bigger.

And this brings me back to Human Design Gate 26.

I have long held the belief that everyshadowis simply unconscious energy “leaking out sideways.”All energy lives on a spectrumand, therefore, there is always a conscious (aka light) side.

When we harness our energy with conscious intent, we make magick. It is just a matter of looking at the shadows through a fresh, non-dualistic, non-judgmental lens.

But gate 26. UGH. I was hearing all the sales coaches in my head telling me that “sales are service.” I was trying to see the gifts, the value, the innate lovability. But the sleazy car salesman just kept appearing in my mind.

I felt myselfcollapsing. Like, this tiny little gate in thewill centerwould be the death of my faith inshadow work. LOL.

And then, it hit me.

Go bigger.

Go bigger than the judgment. Go bigger than the car lot. Go bigger than uncomfortable sales conversations.

Go bigger.

I looked at it in a new light and asked myself what it would look like if I made the definition of the 26 bigger than a mere sleazy car salesman? What would it look like to believe that the natural salesperson inside every human soul is full of light? What if I loved the 26 as much as I love the22? Or the57? Or the61?

What if I opened my mind to the possibility of EVERY quality having potential for beauty, awe, and wonder? And what if I let myself love all of the parts that make up that potential?

The result of that question was a deeper understanding of thespectrumof the 26.

Yes, sales are service when they serve everyone involved. And yes, integrity is the most essential value of the 26. And yes, the 26 does help us move into more expanded possibilities in our lives by selling us the things that can take us there.

But at the heart of the 26 is TRUST in the abundance of the Universe.

In that knowing, I could see myself in the sleazy car salesman. I could see myself trying to control and manipulate others. I could see myself convincing myself that my intentions are pure even when they aren’t.

And with that, my heart exploded with compassion. For me. For the sleazy car salesman. And for everyone who has been in theshadowsof the 26 because they weren’t trusting in the abundance of life.

This applies to so many areas of our lives. Not just sales, marketing, and business.

But, relationships, food, money, love, worthiness. Everything.

What would it look like to trust in the abundance of life?

The answer is in the confidence of the fully conscious 26.

And, if you want to learn how to transform your own perspective of these parts of yourself, get yourmapand go on the journey inside themapportal. It is exactly what happens there.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 26

Using your Human Design to create affirmations is a powerful way to activate the full potential of your chart. Here are some affirmations for Gate 26:

Selling is service when it is in everyone’s best interest.

I trust in the abundance of life and am unattached to outcomes.

## Now it’s your turn to contemplate Human Design Gate 26

When you stand in the Truth that you are worthy of the abundance of life…

Where have you given into the fears of lack and scarcity? And in what ways has that led you to control or manipulate the people around you?

Can you have compassion for yourself?

In what ways can you open up to the abundance of life?

And what does trusting in that abundance look like? How does it change conversations? How does it change your relationship with food, your body, money? How does it change your view of worthiness? And lovability?

What do you need to sell yourself on so that you can finally lean into that trust?

I hope that these questions open you up to all that is available to you. The compassion. The trust. The abundance.

It’s all right there waiting for you. You need to sell yourself on it.

Title: Human Design Gate 27 – Gene Key 27 – The Empowered Caretaker
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 27 isThe Gate of Caring. But I call itThe Empowered Caretakerbecause it’s primary action is to care of others from the abundant overflow of your own self-care.

## About Human Design Gate 27 – Gene Key 27

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 27

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 27 is the energy for finding the balance between self-care and caring for others. Gate 27 takes responsibility for its values, needs, beliefs, thoughts, feelings, and actions to ensure healthy relationships. And from this place, has immense energy for caring for others – especially sick, young, or in need.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 27 is the energy for taking incorrect responsibility for other people’s needs. It self-sacrifices and cares for others in an attempt to prove that it is worthy of safety, love belonging , and support.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling depleted, burnt out or unkind but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design Gate 27 (Gene Key 27)

Gate 27 is defined in my conscious South Node.

The gates in our nodes tell the two-part story of how our soul grows into the realization of our deeper purpose—theincarnation cross.

At first, our purpose can feel distant—quiet, hidden, or even non-existent. But as we grow through the nodal gates—layer by layer—we begin to see that our purpose is already alive and well. It was simply waiting for us to witness it and receive its bounty.

The gate in the South Node marks the first major growth arc toward embodied purpose. It’s the origin story—the area of development that builds the foundation for the second phase, which begins at the Uranus Opposition.

That’s when we begin shifting into the second major growth arc, led by the North Node. As we grow through that gate, we begin to experience the undying presence of our purpose—how everything that came before was preparing us to truly receive the beauty and wisdom of our soul’s purpose.(Inside theHuman Design Map & Portal, you’ll find a guide on transits and planetary seasons like the Uranus Opposition—plus tools and support to help you navigate the path.)

My incarnation cross is the Left Angle Cross of the Clarion 2—a path of intuitive clarity (57), awakening (51), giving voice to truths that cut through illusion (62), and mysticism (61).

But I didn’t always see that unfolding. I saw myself as too much—too woo-woo, too deep, too intense. I thought I needed to tone it all down just to fit in. And I felt purposeless so much of the time.

As I got older and started leaning into the arc of my Gate 27 South Node, I began to prioritize my own care. I started choosing my well-being over people-pleasing—and everything began to shift.

Before that, my life was spent caught in the karmic tension between caring for others and constantly feeling drained. I put my needs at the very end of the line.

I drowned them in food, alcohol, drugs, and sex with strangers. I knew how to “show up” for other people, but I abandoned myself constantly. And when I got sober and quit binge eating, I had to face how little I actually knew about what I needed.

Taking away the addictions left gaping holes I didn’t know how to fill. It was like a crash course in true and deep self-care.

In the beginning of that journey, I didn’t have astrology orHuman Designto help me navigate the path. I relied on surface-level things like Pinterest quotes and cliché Cosmo listicles. And honestly? Some of those things did help.

But the real change began when I was able to take those surface-level tips and alchemize them into real, energetic insight.

That’s where astrology, energy healing, andHuman Designcame in. They helped me see my needs more clearly—beyond coping mechanisms and towardenergetic alignment.

For example, with my5/2 profile, I realized how important it is for my body to get its alone time. I thrive when my days are open and full of space—space to be in natural rhythm, to follow what feels alive, to rest when I need to. And my mind needs to sort through the mess of conventional wisdom and come up with heretical solutions.

(YourHuman Design profileholds so many clues about what you need and how you deliver your gifts. If you’re still figuring yours out, I break it down in depth in theHuman Design Map & Portal.)

That’s just one of many examples. But at the end of the day, when I treat those things as essential care instead of afterthoughts, I feel more connected to myself, my gifts, and my purpose.

Instead of waking up every day and dreading it, I love serving my clients in theMap Portal. My personal relationships feel mutual and grounded. I no longer feel like I have to set myself on fire to keep everyone else warm.

Putting those foundational pieces in place has given me the capacity to lean into the next arc—Gate 28, my North Node. When I’m well-nourished and cared for, I’m more willing to take risks, explore the dark places, and shape the meaning of my life with purpose.

And in turn, that opens up even more trust in my intuition, radical faith in life, potent words, and spiritual exploration.

More importantly, I can see that purpose unfolding. I don’t need to “find my purpose” or look for it in elusive places. It is alive and well. I can feel it in my bones. And I know it in every cell of my being.

Of course, I’m still learning. I’m still softening. I’m still showing up when it gets hard.

And even though it’s messy sometimes, I know—without a shadow of a doubt—that none of that beauty can unfold if I’m abandoning myself.

Onward and upward.

If you’re stuck in patterns of over-giving or struggling to meet your own needs, your chart holds themapfor coming back home to yourself. Whether or not you have Gate 27 defined, honoring the full picture of your energy is the key to creating beauty and purpose in a way you experience in your bones.

I’d love to show you the ropes.👉 Click here to get your Human Design Map & Portal.

### Now it’s your turn to contemplate Gate 27

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of Gate 27 are always available to you (whether it’s defined in your chart or not)…

Are you giving from the overflow? Or are you trying to pull from a dry well?

What do you really need to be able to give from overflow?

Title: Human Design Gate 28 – Gene Key 28 – The Darkness Whisperer
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 28 isThe Gate of The Game Player. But I call itThe Darkness Whispererbecause its primary action is to face the darkness of life by taking conscious risks with courage and tenacity.

## About Human Design Gate 28 – Gene Key 28

Archetype Name:The Darkness Whisperer

In Action:face the darkness in life with courage

Keywords:risk, shadow, and courage

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:The Game Player

Human Design Definition:The transitoriness of power and influence.

Core Theme:Fear of death and purposelessness.

Bodygraph Center:Spleen center and connects to the Root center viahuman design gate 38.

Tropical Sign:Scorpio

Gene Keys Gift:Totality

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 28

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 28 is the energy for facing the darkness in life with courage. Gate 28 embracesthe wisdom of fearand allows fear to walk alongside as it navigates life. In this relationship with fear, gate 28 finds deep joy in overcoming obstacles and can find meaning in purpose in all of life.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 28 is the fear of dying before “finding” or fulfilling apurpose in life. It avoids stillness, silence, and slowing down and attempts to dispel fear with risky behavior. It can easily find itself lost in depression, hopelessness, purposelessness, and meaninglessness.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling dark, rebellious or like a lunatic but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 28 (Gene Key 28)

Gate 28 is defined in my chart 4 times:

- Conscious North Node in 28.2

- Conscious Mars 28.1

- Conscious Uranus 28.5

- Unconscious Uranus 28.2.

In astrology, anytime we have three or more planets in the same sign, it is known as a stellium, which is a fancy word for super important. The energy of the stellium will be like a golden thread that runs through your whole life, creating ripple effects in the rest of your chart.

And, well, with Gate 28 being all about our relationship to death, this one belongs in the “you can’t make this shit up” category.

Death met me early in life.

It was a Wednesday and my second grade teacher pulled me to the side to tell me that my great grandfather had died.

A couple of years later, a grandmother. A popular girl died in a tragic accident during high school. Two close friends died by suicide shortly after.

During my first Saturn return, one of my brothers died in a car accident at age 25, followed quickly by an aunt and my grandfather.

Then, in 2020, my other brother died of a drug overdose at 36, and my grandmother, less than two months later.

The reminder that life is fragile, dotting my life like sprinkles on a cupcake. I learned fast and early that life can change in an instant and in ways you never imagined possible.

We are living AND we are dying. At the same time.

And despite our rugged attempts at trying, we can’t actually run from the reality of nature. The dance between life and death is the way that it is.

For the first part of my life, death was difficult for me to process. Like so many in the West, I was ill equipped and poorly supported in grief and loss.

The world often seemed cruel – like a sick karmic joke. And I found escape in drugs, binge drinking, and sex with strangers. I fell into dark holes of believing that life had no meaning and that I had no purpose except to suffer.

My relationship with death started to shift after my first brother died, though.

In all honesty, I can’t say that I processed his death in a healthy way. But, it did mark a pivotal moment of awakening for me.

As the weeks turned into months, Saturn’s message was clear:

I could not continue the path I was on. I had to change. There were no if’s, and’s, or but’s about it.

The first shift in my awareness was that we have a choice in how we handle grief. We can use it as fuel for expanding our consciousness or we can use it to collapse in the face of life.

Within a few years, I was well on my path with shadow integration work. I had heard about it in my very first training as a coach and was hooked instantly.

Human Design, or even astrology, were not on my radar yet. But, I was consciously walking away from the toxic religious conditioning of my childhood. And I was starting to be recognized for my natural projector gifts as a guide and truth teller.

To my surprise, shadow work seemed like a language that my body already knew how to speak. As I worked with clients, going into the depths of someone’s shame and fear was like a normal day at the office.

I was not afraid of it. I held space for the kind of darkness that most people don’t even know exist. And, through the mystery of Grace, people seemed to be “healed” in my presence.

And, by healed, I mean they were able to see themselves clearly – as a fractal of the Divine – in the Great Mirror of life. My words, shaking them awake and forcing them to surrender under the weight of their Divinity.

And while it looks different and my role isn’t the same, now, I still hold space for that kind of healing today inside theHuman Design Mapportal.

It’s one of the reasons I love Human Design so much – it is like a fast track to the shadows that are in desperate need of our attention, acceptance, and unshakeable love.

And when we meet ourselves there, eyes wide open, miracles happen.

Our consciousness expands and we become capable of holding a broader spectrum of frequencies in our lives. The highs become higher and the lows become lower, and none of it is better or worse. We embrace ourwholeness.

(You’ll learn “how” inside theHuman Design Mapportal.)

It has only been recently that I’ve made the connection between all of thatanddeath.

Richard Rudd, of theGene Keys, talks about the connection between purpose, shadow, and death all the time.  And it was his work, on Gate 28 (Gene Key 28), that opened me up to the connection to begin with.

But it wasn’t until my second brother died, in 2020, that it all started to click.

As weird as it sounds, his death was a profoundly healing experience around purpose and death for me. I write about it in my post onGate 15, which was his conscious sun.

One of the things that became clear was that it is only the ego that dies.

His soul continues to live and breathe. He is with me. I can hear him laugh.

His wild hearted essence still permeates my life. His purpose is alive and well. Minus the attachment.

And when we are transforming our shadows into light, when we are facing the deepest darkest parts of ourselves, we are letting go of attachments.

(You’ll learn how all that works – in the context of your Human Design – inside theHuman Design Mapportal.)

Our ego – the parts of ourselves that are attached to being seen as good, worthy, enough – dies. The strings of attachment turning to ash in the fires of Fierce Grace.

We understand, however briefly, that we are whole. We let go of the shame. We become humbled by the power of unconditional love.

And then, we do it again and again. Meeting ourselves there.

Dying. Dying. Dying again.

I have often joked that I’ve lived many lifetimes in this one life. Or that past me would be dead or in jail by now.

The transformations I’ve gone through are nothing short of wild AF. Like, how in the world did I go from being a strung out addict to being a guide to thousands inside theHuman Design Mapportal?

I understand now that it is because of all of the attachments I’ve let go of.

In the words of Carl Jung, I would rather be whole than good. Trying to be good was killing me. And letting go seemed like the only choice to make.

That isn’t to say that it is easy or that I always navigate it with Grace. It gets messy AF and I have moments I’m not proud of.

But, I do take comfort in the thought that only the ego dies. And that I’ve done that a million times already.

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of gate 28 are always available to you, (whether it’s defined in your chart or not)…

Title: Human Design Gate 29 – Gene Key 29 – The Faithful Devotee￼
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 29 isThe Gate of Perseverance. But I call itThe Faithful Devoteebecause its primary action is being faithful to the things that matter.

## About Human Design Gate 29 – Gene Key 29

Keywords:devotion, rapture, and tenacious commitment

Bodygraph Center:Sacral center and connects to the G center viahuman design gate 46.

Gene Keys Gift:Commitment

Gene Keys Siddhi:Devotion

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 29

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 29 is the energy for being faithful and devoted to the things that matter. To Gate 29, commitment, faith, and devotion are magical medicine when they come from the heart and from what truly lights you up. But poison when they come from obligation, fear, or as an attempt to prove your worthiness. In this knowing, it has the energy to be devoted from a place of love and being lit up.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 29 is the energy for feeling burned out or overcommitted. If it gets trapped in cycles of trying to prove its worthiness and stays devoted to things that don’t really matter, it can quickly become depleted and frustrated.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling fickle, fanatical or submissive but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 29 (Gene Key 29)

One of the things I am often talking to Generators and Manifesting Generators, both insidethe mapportal and otherwise, is that when the sacral says YES to something, it is an indicator of long term commitment, not just the present moment.

Some of them have been disillusioned by the promises of “following their strategy and authority.” When they say YES to something they love or that “lights them up”, they are surprised when challenges crop up, some parts feel really hard, or, heaven forbid, when it simply doesn’t work out.

Maybe they felt completely lit up by a job opportunity and they didn’t get hired. Or they responded to a need in the marketplace with their services and no one purchased. Or they moved into their dream home and it ended up being a nightmare.

They often think they must not have been really listening to their authority and begin questioning themselves. Or, they become upset with the system because of its broken promises.

The problem here is two fold.

For one, the marketing within the Human Design space often makes it look like “following your strategy and authority” will lead you to a life of pure bliss and mattresses full of money.

And it just doesn’t work that way.

Human Design does not give us a free pass from the real, lived Human experience. To be a human means a life that is a mix of a broad spectrum of emotions, experiences, and circumstances. Some parts will be amazing AF and other parts will just plain suck.

And things aren’t going right or wrong, either way. Life just is what it is.

Human Design is a beautiful doorway into self-discovery. And in some cases, will even feel like a huge permission slip tofinallybe authentic.

But it won’t solve the challenges of life.

Which leads me to the second part of the problem.

A sacral YES isn’t a promise of bliss. That isn’t what the sacral does – at all.

The sacral sustains life.

Within the sacral, we see the energy for making babies, caring for others, and seeing projects through. None of which will be a cake walk 24/7.

When the sacral says yes, it is saying:

I have the energy to sustain raising a child, including changing shitty diapers.

This project is going to be epic and I have what it takes to get it done, no matter what challenges crop up along the way.

I’m going to grow this garden; I will water it, feed it, deal with the pests, and harvest the fruits of my labor.

That is what the sacralloves to do. Seeing it through is what lights up a sacral like the most stunning sunrise you’ve ever seen. Finding your way through the balance of the baby smiles and shitty diapers is the recipe for satisfaction.

Which brings me back to gate 29.

When I first wrote the contemplation for the 29, I’d had a bit of an epiphany that thedevotionof the 29 was different thancommitment.

I realize now, though, that the words I used didn’t do a great job of saying what I was seeing. What I was attempting to do was give voice to the trying to the difference between the sacral and the will, particularly in the lower frequencies.

Both my sacral and will center are undefined. And teasing apart the differences is something that has been a big part of my wisdom journey.

I see it more clearly now.

In the highest frequency, the 29 isdevoted(aka committed) to the callings of the higher heart (what I call the G center). It listens for the voice of the magnetic monopole (aka soul) and follows it relentlessly by surrendering its outdated egoic attachments.

In the highest frequency, the will center summons willpower to break through the limits of the ego. It doesn’t use willpower to force “incorrect” shit to happen. It serves (40), competes (51), sells (26), and takes charge (21) to expand its consciousness of what it means to be a human with a functioning ego.

But in the lower frequencies, the sacral will stick with it because they think they should, not because they love it and find it truly satisfying. And the will uses willpower to stay stuck inside an egoic box.

And what I often see is Gens and Mani Gens using low frequency willpower to fuel the commitments that just don’t fit anymore. The warm soft glow of the lit up sacral has long burned out. So, they start forcing themselves just to stay in the outdated identity.

Like someone who stays in a shitty marriage because they don’t know who they are without their spouse. They are so attached to the identity of being married that they start using willpower to show up in the marriage.

This, of course, often happens with non-sacral types as well. And the deconditioning we do with Human Design really helps us to explore all the ways we are forcing energy rather than flowing with it.

And what the 29 shows up, so beautifully, is that sticking with something is actually quite satisfying, when it is the higher heart calling the shots, rather than society, culture, and corrupt tribal attachments.

When we are coming from our own inner wisdom – the higher heart – the energy will be there. And surrendering to that truth is the magic.

If you want some guidance on your path of surrender, grab yourmapand meet me in the portal.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 29

Using your Human Design to create affirmations is a powerful way to activate the full potential of your chart. Here are some affirmations for Gate 29:

I am devoted to whatever lights me up.

It isn’t my action that matters – it is the energy that drives my action.

I overcome obstacles with creativity and joy.

Inside yourHuman Design Map, you’ll get a full list of empowering beliefs for your type + strategy, authority, profile, and all four gates of yourincarnation crossand show you how to go from affirmation to full-on embodiment. In the meantime, be sure to also check out my post onhow to make Human Design affirmations work.

### Now it’s your turn to contemplate Gate 29

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of gate 29 are always available to you, (whether it’s defined in your chart or not)…

What are you devoted to? Why? Do you like your reasons?

What types of obstacles do you actually enjoy overcoming?

Where do you want to cultivate more devotion in your life?

I encourage you to take some time with these questions. Take them out into your world and let their answers reveal themselves to you. Intend for deeper levels of clarity about gate 29.

And, if you have gate 29 in yourHuman Design Incarnation Cross, be sure to check out theHuman Design Mapwhere I go super deep into each gate of your cross.

Title: Human Design Gate 30 – Gene Key 30 – The Deep Feeler
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 30 isThe Gate of Feelings. But I call itThe Deep Feelerbecause its primary action is reveling in the intensity of desire and emotion.

## About Human Design Gate 30 – Gene Key 30

Archetype Name:The Deep Feeler

In Action:Reveling in the intensity of desire and emotion

Keywords:feelings, desire, intensity, and emotions

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:The Clinging Fire – Feelings

Human Design Definition:Freedom recognized as an illusion and limitation accepted as a fate

Core Theme:Fear of the fates.

Bodygraph Center:Emotional Solar Plexus center and connects to the root center viahuman design gate 41.

Tropical Sign:Aquarius/Pisces

Gene Keys Shadow:Desire

Gene Keys Gift:Lightness

Gene Keys Siddhi:Rapture

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 30

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 30 is the energy for reveling in the intensity of desire and emotion. Gate 30 has an innate knowing that a full spectrum of intense feelings are a natural part of the human experience. From this place, it is able to draw in, feel, and process the depths of desire through a lens of human emotion.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 30 is the energy for destructive sensation and/or intensity seeking. Without surrendering to the full spectrum of emotion, Gate 30 can lose it’s faith in life and the connection to desire.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling insatiable, depraved or solicitous but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 30 (Gene Key 30)

At this point, I have surrendered to my love affair with theHuman Design gates(andthe lines:D).

The gates capture the essence of the archetypal journey of being human and give us such clear and precise language to express our experiences.

By understanding thefull spectrumof potential in the gates, they can alchemize judgment into compassion and shame into wholeness. They show us that there isn’t just one side of the story and that how we work with any given energy determines our overall vibration.

When we work skillfully with the energy of any gate in the chart, it vibrates at a higher frequency than when we are completely unconscious of our expression of it.

(I’ll do a deep dive on the full spectrum of potential for all the gates in yourincarnation crossin yourHuman Design Map.)

Gate 30 is the one that demonstrated this in a way that I will never forget.

Gate 30 and mysolar plexusareundefined, so part of my higher purpose is gathering wisdom about emotional energy.

And gather wisdom, I have. 😂

Like many others in my generation (and the generations before me), I was taught to be afraid and ashamed of my emotions. I was conditioned to believe that my emotions were a problem (even the so-called positive ones) and that I was terrible and wrong for expressing them.

Plus, I was raised in an environment where certain emotions meant literal danger, and I became hypervigilant in being an emotional caretaker to keep myself safe.

To soothe my emotions, I began binge eating at the age of 8, and that turned to exercise bulimia in my early teens. That eventually turned into drugs and alcohol in my early adult years.

During my first Saturn Return, one of my brothers died in a car accident. As profound loss and significant astrological milestones tend to do, this was a major turning point in my life.

Within a few years, I had completely turned my life around. I got into therapy and started to learn about my emotions.

As time progressed, I started to see that all of the emotions moving through me weren’t my own. I was often taking on the emotions of others and made myself responsible for resolving them. Food, exercise, drugs, and alcohol were my ways of dealing with the truth – that shit was never mine to hold.

Because that is the thing about other people’s emotions – no matter how open, undefined, or wise we are – we can’t do other people’s emotional work for them.

With that awareness, I started to embody clearer boundaries. I prioritizedspending lots of time in my own pure auraand developed discernment about which emotions belonged to me and which ones didn’tdidn’t.

I did a metric fuck ton of shadow integration work around the way I found so-called worthiness in being other people’s emotional dumping ground and how hard it often felt to let go of shit that wasn’t mine.

The more clarity I got and integrated I became, something magickal happened.

I started to notice that when emotions were actually mine to deal with and when I revered them enough to be present with them, they weren’t so scary. I realized that they hold potent wisdom and that allowing them is how you access that wisdom.

(I’ll teach you how inside theHuman Design Mapportal (no matter your solar plexus definition.)

And true to the highest frequency of gate 30, I found that I could even experience pleasure in so-called negative emotions.

The real turning point was when I had an orgasm while processing shame.

Yes, you read that correctly. Feeling shame gave me an orgasm.

I told you I had an experience I will never forget. 😉

If you would have told me that was possible two decades ago, there is no world in which I would have believed you. You might not even believe me right now.

But, it is true. And it was a Graceful Awakening like no other.

As they say in the East, a meeting with the Divine and the rivers changes course.

I came to understand (pun kind of intended) that we are incarnate to experience what it means to be human. And deep, dark, intense emotion is part of that experience.

Our soul (aka the magnetic monopole) desires the WHOLE experience, not just the parts that our minds have come to judge as “right.”

It would be dishonest to say that I’m perfect at allowing my emotions. I’m definitely not.

The metaphor of personal growth being like an onion didn’t become a cliche for no reason. There are always new layers to explore and more subtle realms to play in.

But I am forever changed and have developed a curiosity about my emotions that just wasn’t possible before. I’ve given myself deeper permission to allow my feelings to flow, to trust their wisdom, and to stay present even when it becomes very intense.

I now know, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that I can not only handle my emotions but also revel in them.

The possibilities are endless, and I can give my soul what it desires more than anything else – depth, richness, and intensity.

This is an amazing part of being fully alive, and I’m here for it. And if you have been resistant to your emotions, I encourage you to open up to the idea that you can revel in them, too.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 30

Using your Human Design to create affirmations is a powerful way to activate the full potential of your chart. Here are some affirmations for Gate 30:

My desire is an evolutionary impulse.

I revel in the full spectrum of emotion.

I adore my insatiable desire for deep emotional experiences.
