Title: Human Design Gate 42 – Gene Key 42 – The Celebration Doula
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 42 isThe Gate of Growth. But I call itThe Celebration Doulabecause its primary action is to bring projects, dreams, and goals into their full potential.

## About Human Design Gate 42 – Gene Key 42

Archetype Name:The Celebration Doula

In Action:finish things and celebrate accomplishments

Keywords:celebration, closing loops, and seeing things through

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Growth

Human Design Definition:The expansion of the resources which maximizes the development of full potential.

Core Theme:Closing cycles and bringing things to an end.

Bodygraph Center:Sacral center and connects to the Root center viahuman design gate 53.

Tropical Sign:Aries

Gene Keys Shadow:Expectation

Gene Keys Gift:Detachment

Gene Keys Siddhi:Celebration

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 42

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 42 is the energy for seeing things through to the end and celebrating accomplishments. Gate 42 believes that the future is bright with possibilities and uses that belief as fuel for bringing projects, dreams, and goals into their full potential.

On the other end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 42 is the energy for unhealthy attachment, repeating the same patterns over and over again, and trying to control how things end through rebellion or self-sabotage (especially in relationships or in business).

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling controlling or rebellious but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design (Gene Key 42)

Gate 42 is undefined in my chart, but I do haveHuman Design Gate 53defined (the other side of the Channel of Maturation). And, to be honest, I’ve often found myself trying to solve the “never finish what I start” problem.

I am really good at starting things. Like, really, really good.

But finishing is a whole other story. And it has been a source of shame for my entire life.

Understanding all of my neurodivergence has helped heal some of that. But learning more about my chart—a non-sacralbeing, undefinedroot, hanging53—helped me put it all in a context that made it easy to understand and practical.

My energy for finishing is meant to be inconsistent; I didn’t incarnate to finish everything I start. I incarnated to gain wisdom about what it means to finish the things that are aligned and let go of the rest.

By taking off the pressure of having to finish everything I start, I was able to notice—without judgment—how many “open loops” I had in my life.

Some of those loops were obvious—half-finished art projects or laundry that had to be rewashed 12 times because I kept forgetting it—but others were sneakier.

Like the dining room table full of antique store finds I never quite got around to cleaning, finding a place for, or even unpacking. It seemed logical to just leave all of it on the table until it was “processed.”

But, as I started looking closely at the “not finishing” pattern in my life, that logic started to fall apart.

See, my husband and I love to go thrifting and antique shopping. Our home décor has an eclectic organic modern meets mystical sigil magick vibe. I love the alchemy of taking something old and giving it a new purpose (hello,Human Design Gate 28) and old junk really works for that.

But as gate 42 worked its magick on me, I could clearly see that all of those unpacked antiques were a physical manifestation of overloading my to-do list. It was about the antiques. But it was also about more than the antiques.

The bottom line was this:

I was putting way too much stuff on my to do list. I had so much “to do” that it would take many lifetimes to finish it all—and the piles on the dining room table were just adding even more.

At first, this awareness was really depressing.

I wondered if it meant that we couldn’t spend our weekends wandering around our favorite shops. Or exploring new shops on our travels to seeTrevor Hallplay. Or if I’d have to settle for getting mainstream decor while buying toothpaste at Target.

But even deeper than that, the conditioning of my undefinedwill centerstarted to speak.

And suddenly, clear as day, I knew that my never-ending to-do list was a way I attempted to prove my worthiness.

(Side note: If you notice the same pattern of trying to prove your worth, I’ll help you unwind it in the​Human Design Map & Portal​.)

To be honest, though, part of me didn’t want to let go of the idea that one day I’d get my shit together. That part loved the belief that one day I would do enough to earn all the gold stars. That there really was some sort of list I could check off to get the coveted worthiness award. That one day, I would stop being so broken and be able to just finish what I started.

But, a stronger part of me also knows what I tell my​Human Design Map & Portal​people all the time:

When you are pursuing a life of purpose, you have to take worthiness off the table of discussion. Because here’s the deal:

Worthiness is not a real thing. It is a made-up construct of the ego (will center). And really getting that is an essential part of deconditioning, even if your will center is defined.

When I let go of the idea that I needed to earn worthiness, I developed more discernment about how much I could take on in any given moment.

That’s when I started making different choices—even with the beloved piles of antiques. I started a new experiment:

If the last trip’s stuff isn’t processed, we don’t go on another trip. 😱

I experimented in other ways, too. I stopped saying yes to every single thing that came my way. I learned the difference betweenattention and recognition. I questioned where the energy to start was coming from.

Was it a true point of alchemy in my life (Gate 53)?

Was it aligned with my purpose, calling, wisdom, and authority?

Or was it just another attempt to meet the rules of what I thought I needed to prove that day?

With practice, my “plate” started to get clearer and clearer; I became more and more discerning about what was mine to start and finish, and what wasn’t. Eventually, I noticed that there was more room in my life to just breathe and be. We even got rid of the dining room table all together.

This experiment ultimately led to a deeper sense of self-compassion. And things look different now.

We buy way less. And I’m more intentional about my mindset going into a thrift or antique store. My to do list is more refined and focused. I keep my big projects to a minimum and aim to focus on the ones that serve my people better, either onmy website, onsubstack, or in the​Human Design Map & Portal​.

I’m definitely not done “becoming wise” in finishing things. And for sure, some random antique that has no place in my home will eventually find its way to me. And I’ll become even wiser.

But, even when it does, I’m not going to be an asshole to myself about any of it. I understand thatworthiness is an optional storythat has nothing to do with my true purpose in this world.

What really matters is being honest with myself and trusting the process as I learn more about the delicate balance between starting and finishing.

If you’re feeling called to explore how old patterns are playing out in your life, the​Human Design Map & Portal​is here to guide you. I won’t promise you’ll finish everything you start—but I will help you uncover what truly matters, and how to follow it without shame, force, or hustle.​Click here to get started​.

I know when to let go and when to be tenacious.

Title: Human Design Gate 43 – Gene Key 43 – The Listener Within
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 43 isThe Gate of Insight. But I call itThe Listener Withinbecause its primary action is to tune into ideas that create breakthroughs.

## About Human Design Gate 43 – Gene Key 43

Archetype Name:The Listener Within

In Action:listen to and trust your internal wisdom

Keywords:inner listening, self-awareness, and breakthroughs

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Insight

Human Design Definition:In order for achievement to be maintained a new order must be fairly established.

Core Theme:Fear of rejection.

Bodygraph Center:Ajna center and connects to the Throat center viahuman design gate 23.

Tropical Sign:Scorpio

Gene Keys Shadow:Deafness

Gene Keys Gift:Insight

Gene Keys Siddhi:Epiphany

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 43

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On one end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 43 is like being a hotline for Universal wisdom and truth and staying true to inner wisdom . It is like a radio tuned into ideas that create breakthroughs and making space for radical transformation to occur.

On the other end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 43 is the energy for listening to others instead of listening to your own inner wisdom. This clouds your ability to hear your inner truth and can cause worry, doubt, or confusion.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling worried, illogical or rebellious but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design Gate 43 (Gene Key 43)

Gate 43 isdefinedin my conscious Venus placement. Which indicates that I highly value, and see the beauty in, listening to my own inner wisdom, rather than relying on others to guide me.

AND, because I am a human being who was raised in the era of tribal empowerment and “family values” (1615 – 2026) over individual empowerment and the honoring of inner spirit (2027 – 2438), like almost everyone walking on this planet, I was deeply conditioned to ignore my inner wisdom.

I was taught most of my life that my inner wisdom was wrong, sinful, and too much for the people around me. What I wanted to do with my life was never on the table of discussion. And I was encouraged to ignore the inklings, the moments of insight, and the ring of truth in my own voice.

I know that I am not alone in that.

It is why we are seeing such an increase in people who are interested in systems likeHuman Design, Astrology, the Enneagram, Meyers Briggs, and all the other systems that help people understand themselves better.

We have been taught our entire lives that all power resides outside of ourselves and that the most important thing is to keep other people – especially those in authority – happy.

So, it makes complete sense that we don’t know how to listen to our own inner wisdom! Literally, how could it be any other way. Almost no one on this planet has been taught to go within to find their inner compass. And that is why we see so many people who are stuck in some flavor of theirnot-self themes.With each choice to ignore your inner wisdom and do what other people think you should, you drill into your subconscious that you are not enough, that the power resides outside of you, and that you are unworthy of a life of satisfaction, success, peace, and delight.

When you allow your life to be run by toxic religious beliefs, new-age superstition, and/or patriarchal systems of control,  you perpetuate the story that your inner wisdom means nothing.

And there is only one way out:going within, listening to your inner voice, and doing the healing work it takes to make the leap towards your north star.

The time when we can blame the world around us for our sufferings is quickly passing. It is time to find your internal source of power and use it.

That is exactly what you’ll learn how to do inside theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, the first step is to create time and space to actually hear the sound of your inner wisdom ring through you like a bell. And that means time and space that is completely free from the influence of other people’s thoughts, ideas, and insights. I call this “pure aura time” and it is one of the first steps I recommend to all of my map clients.

In essence, pure aura time is you spending time alone, no podcasts, books, music, no work, no social media scrolling, nothing but you, yourself, and you.

Now, that doesn’t mean you need to be precious about it. Your pure aura time does not need to be bubble baths on mountain tops with Unicorns frolicing in fields of rainbows and butterflies.

It can be as simple as driving to work, doing the dishes, or going on a walk – minus the earbuds. It can be taking an extra three minutes on your pee break at work and just breathing. It can be a tiny moment of placing your hand on your heart and tuning into what is really going on with you.

In order to thrive, you need it.

And listen, I don’t use the word “need” lightly.

I am a rebel at heart. When you tell me there is something I need to do, I can assure you that me and my neurodivergent brain will find a way out.

But this is an area that it matters.

Now is the time to make space to hear the sound of your own inner voice. To free your nervous system from the pressure of others’ opinions, to listen to your heart, and to work through the baggage that keeps you from making choices that are aligned with what you hear. Stop giving your power away.

Make the space.

Go within.

Listen to your inner wisdom.

Trust what you hear.

If you’d like some help along the way, get yourmapand go on the journey inside themapportal.

Title: Human Design Gate 44 – Gene Key 44 – The Pattern Interrupter
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 44 isThe Gate of Alertness. But I call itThe Pattern Interrupterbecause its primary action is to sense the habitual patterns that need to be broken to create well-being and prosperity.

## About Human Design Gate 44 – Gene Key 44

Archetype Name:The Pattern Interrupter

In Action:to practice forgiveness and learn from mistakes

Keywords:seeing patterns, the past, transformation, and possibility

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Alertness

Human Design Definition:The success of any interaction is based on the absence of any preconditions.

Core Theme:Fear of the past.

Bodygraph Center:Spleen center and connects to the Will center viahuman design gate 26.

Tropical Sign:Scorpio

Gene Keys Shadow:Interference

Gene Keys Gift:Teamwork

Gene Keys Siddhi:Synarchy

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 44

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 44 is the energy for practicing forgiveness and and learning from mistakes.

Gate 44 has a deep and primal knowing that every moment, including memory,  holds the potential for healing and transformation.

With this knowing, it can guide others to break painful patterns from the past. It uses those patterns as a way to learn, grow, and, most importantly, forgive.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 44 is the energy of being afraid to repeat mistakes from the past and using those mistakes as a “reason” to not move forward. This internal resistance to the mistakes of the past actually prevents the ability to transform, learn, and grow.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling rash, hasty or untrustworthy but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 44 (Gene Key 44)

Gate 44 is defined in my Unconscious North Node.

## Before diving in, let me give you a bit of context by sharing how I interpret some of the mechanics here…

### Conscious and Unconscious

The conscious side of the chart – sometimes referred to as the personality or the mind – is on the right side of the chart. Traditionally, definition on the conscious side is colored in black and reveals who we believe ourselves to be and the primary places where our consciousness is expanding.

The unconscious side of the chart – sometimes called the body or design – is on the left side of the chart. Traditionally, definition on the unconscious side is colored in red and reveals the primary “shadows” that “block” the full expansion of the gates on the conscious side.

By healing and integrating the wisdom of the unconscious side, you automatically expand your capacity for fuller expression of the gates on the conscious side of the chart.

### North and South Nodes with a little Conscious Sun thrown in for good measure

The nodes are like petri dishes for observing the growth and expansion of theincarnation cross.

And because the conscious sun makes up 70% of the energy in the chart, it is the gate where you will see the most growth. Everything else in the chart is in service to that growth.

(I cover the details of your incarnation cross inside theHuman Design Map.)

Before your Uranus Opposition (around age 42), your “petri dish” is the gate in your south node and after, it is the gate in your north node.

### Using the mechanics of my chart as an example, here is what that looks like.

My cross:LAX of the Clarion 2 (57/51, 62/61)

My Conscious Sun:Gate 57– The most important gate in my chart and cross.

My Conscious North Node:Gate 28 – Since my Uranus Opposition has already passed, this is my “petri dish.”

My Unconscious North Node:Gate 44 – And this is the “block” to full expansion and expression ofgate 28.

The highest expression of gate 57 is intuitive clarity and the lowest expression is the discomfort that signals that intuition is being ignored.(I’ll cover the high and low expressions of your incarnation cross inside theHuman Design Map.)

And my conscious north node isgate 28, which is all about our fear of death, taking risks, and deriving purpose from the darkness of life.

So, for me, that means that taking risks and intentionally creating purpose out of the dark stuff of life (28) will grow my capacity to trust my intuition (57).

And in order to do that, I will need to heal my relationship with the past and the mistakes that I’ve made along the way (gate 44).

## Back to gate 44…

And, well, that is exactly how it has played out for me.

As I have gotten older, I’ve done a lot of reflecting on my past and forgiving myself for so many of the mistakes that I’ve made. As I’ve turned the past into wisdom, creating purpose and meaning is much easier for me. It is like the “darkness” of what has been becomes fuel for

For much of my life, I made almost everything in life mean that life was meaningless and that I had no purpose.

With gate 28 in my chart four times, I am no stranger to the darkness of life and turning that into purpose has been a relentless quest. I’ve often used my past as a weapon against myself and as proof that something is wrong with me.

True to gate 24 in my unconscious south node, I have also been someone who ruminates in the past and have had paralyzing fears of repeating the same mistakes.

Now, I am seeing more clearly that mistakes really are just a part of life and that the past only has the meaning we give it. And, even more profoundly, there is actually no reason to revisit the past if it isn’t for the specific purposes of moving forward. What really matters is now and how we are using the energy that is available to us.

And in the cases where revisiting the past is helpful, it must be done with compassion (human design gate 36), forgiveness (human design gate 4), and Grace (human design gate 22).

These days, I am catching myself when I am falling into old patterns of using my past mistakes against myself. I am cultivating the mindset that everything is happening for my awakening (human design gate 51) and that right now is what matters most. I am using the healing process I teach inside theHuman Design Mapportal.

And, most importantly, I am remembering that I am a fallible human being and that is OK.

Now is the only moment that matters. And it is all in service to my intuitive clarity (57).

I can lead a horse to water but cannot make them drink.

Title: Human Design Gate 45 – Gene Key 45 – The Money Steward
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 45 isThe Gate of The Gatherer. But I call itThe Money Stewardbecause its primary action is to be fully aware of both the spiritual and mundane power that money holds and wield it with equity.

### About Human Design Gate 45 – Gene Key 45

Archetype Name:The Money Steward

In Action:effectively and equitably manage resources, especially money

Keywords:leadership, money, wellbeing, and the distribution of resources

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:The Gatherer

Human Design Definition:The natural and generally beneficial attraction of like forces.

Core Theme:Leading through education.

Bodygraph Center:Throat center and connects to the Will center viahuman design gate 21.

Tropical Sign:Gemini

Gene Keys Shadow:Dominance

Gene Keys Gift:Synergy

Gene Keys Siddhi:Communion

​​(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 45

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 45 is the energy for leadership, money and wellbeing. To Gate 45 money is power and it is a master at managing, using, and distributing material resources (especially money) in service to family, friends, and community. Gate 45 is fully aware of both the spiritual and mundane power that money holds and wields it with equity.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 45 is the energy for hoarding money or resources. It may try to knock others down so that it may rise up. Or it might even unconsciously stay broke in an attempt to prove spiritual “worthiness.”

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are knocking others down for your own gain but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 45 (Gene Key 45)

I’ve shared that I haveGate 54(not a typo!) in my mid-heaven (note: mid-heaven does not create definition in Human Design). Taken at face value, myGate 54mid-heaven means that embodying prosperity as a spiritual path is a significant part of the legacy I will leave.

And, while I can’t know what my legacy will be, I do know thatGate 54has been an important mirror for me. I’ve come a long way in my money story (and bottom line!), and letting go of the belief that “money isn’t spiritual” has been a key part of that. As part of that letting go, I’ve had to confront my relationship with Gate 45 directly.

Gate 45 is undefined in my chart. And it’s fair to say that I’ve learned the hard way about managing money and resources. I’m definitely gathering wisdom. ;)

Only recently did I heal the story that I was irresponsible with money.

By looking at my money management situations and habits with clear-eyed compassion, I’ve come to understand that I am a wise steward of money. At this point, I would even go so far as to say that I am smart with money. Of course, I am not perfect—of course—but I’m not irresponsible, clueless, or powerless in handling money.

Essentially, I put my money where my mouth is by using my money for the things that align with my values.

I invest in myself, my dreams, and what matters to me. I donate to causes I care about every month, and I show recognition by paying people for their work. I pay all of the​MAP​ Team members fairly, and I’m the main breadwinner in my house.

I can even go to Target without buying a thing I don’t need and will walk out empty handed if they don’t have what I went for. The profit margins in my business are no longer an afterthought, and I don’t go into debt without deep consideration of the consequences.

Some of that amazes me to be able to say. It makes me feel proud of how far I’ve come.

But it hasn’t always been that way.

For decades, I believed the patriarchal lie that, as a woman, I am irresponsible with money.

I internalized the message that I could not be trusted with money, that I was incapable of understanding how money works, and that managing money was better left to the men in my life.

I had buckets of “evidence” that those stories were true, too. After all, believing is seeing. (not a typo, again!)

When I was 18 years old, one of my brothers — may he rest in power — wrecked my car, and getting it fixed was not an option. I was working a part-time minimum-wage job and couch surfing. And I knewnothingabout how moneyactuallyworks.

I was raised under the guise of scarcity and an assumption that I’d never amount to much (financially or otherwise).

My education about money came down to this:

- Get a job. Any job. It didn’t matter how much I liked it.

- Work really fucking hard for the rest of my life. Retirement wasn’t for people like us.

- Pray that robbing Peter to pay Paul wouldn’t be my fate.

I was also taught that rich people are terrible and that money is the root of all evil.

When the car was wrecked beyond repair, and despite my financial situation, my parents to buy a new one “on credit.”

I did not know what “on credit” meant or that, because of my financial situation, I setting myself up for failure. I did not understand that this decision was setting me up for decades of “bad credit” and shame. And I didn’t know that the salesman telling me I could get a “cosigner” was a clue that I wasn’t ready to take on the loan.

I was told that this was just the way it was.

And it turned into a dumpster fire.

I could not make the payments, and in less than a year, I was being chased by the repo man.

I didn’t know that I should let the cosigner know so they could make the payment. And even if I had known, I would have been too ashamed to tell them. I’m not even sure I understood they could take the car away.

Once I realized what was happening, I tried to hide the car. For my job, I’d park in crazy places and walk really far, and since I was couch surfing, there was no reliable place to find me “at home.”

But, after about a week, the repo man finally caught up with me.

I “ruined” my credit and my cosigner’s credit.

More importantly, my cosigner couldn’t understand why I never came to them when I knew I couldn’t pay.

So, not only did my choice financially haunt me (and them) for years to come, but it also drove a wedge in a deeply valued relationship, too.

From then on, the evidence of my financial irresponsibility only grew. The shame lasted for decades after the repossession fell off my credit report; it seemed obvious that I was too fucked up to handle money wisely.

And, in all honesty, it didn’t matter much, anyway. For most of my twenties, I was broke, on drugs, binge drinking, and avoiding life altogether.

Even after I got completely sober, cleaned up my life, and started my business, I was in extreme cycles of not enough having enough money and, when I did have some, spending it on shit that didn’t matter.

The tables started to run when my income dramatically increased in a short period of time.(Shout out to recognizing myself, calling myself out, and owning the value of my innate gifts with the​Human Design Map​!)

Something one of my mentors said many years ago started to come into focus. She said something like:

“People say that money won’t buy happiness. But having money does solve a lot of problems.

And when you solve your money problems, and you no longer feel afraid or worried about money, you can use all that energy to make an even bigger contribution to the world.

When you have plenty of money, you can easily distribute it to the people who really need it without harming yourself. “

Talk about gate 45 vibes! And it truly changed my life.

Having, making, and being a steward of money is a privilege.

To be clear, I don’t say that as a moral judgment or to say that you don’t “have it hard” in other ways. But only to acknowledge that when you have money, there are things you don’thave to think aboutor consider to live your daily life. You get to use that energy for other things, whereas others have to focus solely on where money will come from to survive.

When you have plenty of money, you don’t have to worry about how the mortgage will get paid. Or how food will end up on the table, the price of eggs, or what store has this or that on sale. You don’t have to decide between putting gas in your car or giving your kid lunch money.

All of that energy can be channeled into other things.

I did not have the privilege of money for most of my life. My family was dirt poor when I was growing up, and most of my adulthood was spent deciding what would get paid and what wouldn’t.

So, when I started making more money, my eyes were opened to how irresponsible I believed I was. And I started to recognize that the way we manage money has two parts:

- Our values. When we don’t know our values (aka the things that matter to us) we will spend our money based on other people’s values, thoughts, and opinions.

- Owning the value we bring to the world. When we don’t embody the value wenaturallybring to the world, we will have shitty boundaries, give until it bleeds, and under-earn.

When we clean those two things up, money and how we manage it completely transform into abundance and generosity. That is what it means to be a good steward of money and what my mentor said all those years ago.

Now, I see that I am actually really good at putting my money where my mouth is. And because I practice what I preach inside the​MAP portal​, I’m also getting better and better at owning the value I have to share with others.

And what I know for sure is that money is a mirror, and a mirror must be polished often.

I can trust myself with money.

I can decide what “being responsible” with money looks like and how important that is to me.

I AM a wise steward of money.

I love circulating money.

I use money to make a more authentic contribution.

I invest in my values.

I own the value I bring to the world.

When I catch myself thinking that I am irresponsible with money, I remind myself of these things. These new ways of thinking are my self-concept now, and I look forward to more and more wisdom about handling money.

I am not irresponsible with money. I am a powerful channel for the flow of abundance and generosity.

Speaking of owning the value I bring to the world, you’ll love the​Human Design Map​if you want to step into a self-concept that aligns with your design, make authentic decisions, and let go of people-pleasing.​Get yours here​.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 45

I easily manage material resources.

When everyone’s needs are met – including my own – the whole kingdom thrives.

The mundane and the spiritual are one and the same.

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of Gate 45 are always available to you (whether it’s defined in your chart or not)…

Are you aware of the spiritual power of money?

How might you be a wise steward of money?

I encourage you to take some time with these questions. Take them out into your world and let their answers reveal themselves to you. Intend for deeper levels of clarity about gate 45.

And, if you have gate 45 in yourHuman Design Incarnation Cross, be sure to check out theHuman Design Mapwhere I go super deep into each gate of your cross.

Title: Human Design Gate 46 – Gene Key 46 – The Embodiment Master
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 46 isThe Gate of Determination of the Self. But I call itThe Embodiment Masterbecause its primary action is enjoying the human body.

## About Human Design Gate 46 – Gene Key 46

Archetype Name:The Faithful Devotee

In Action:enjoying my human body

Keywords:body love, reveling in life, bliss, and embodiment

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 46

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 46 is the energy for enjoying being alive in a human body. Gate 46 knows that every part of life is an opportunity for Divine Grace and that the body is a vehicle for the soul. In that knowing, it cultivates presence in its body and delights in synchronicity.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 46 is the energy for creating chaos in its life by avoiding the present moment or taking life way too seriously. This can lead to buffering with food, drugs, alcohol, or anything else that dulls the body.  It can be prone to Spiritual bypassing, materialism, or ego.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling twisted, strange or depraved but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 46 (Gene Key 46)

Gate 46.6 is defined in my conscious mercury. I interpret that to mean that I am here to communicate the wisdom of embodiment.

(BTW, if you are aHuman Design Mapclient and a business owner, I talk about the relevance of mercury in the context of business inside the portal.)

I also have a defined head with channel61/24(called the channel of awareness), which means that I am no stranger to esoteric knowledge, mysticism, (61) and grounding that with reason (24).

And something I have gotten on my 5th line soap box about a bazillion times is that spiritual knowledge means nothing if it isn’t embodied.

As the cliche goes, we aren’t human beings having a spiritual experience, we are spiritual beings having a human experience.

True to my 46 being in the 6th line, though, it has taken me some time to really see how that plays out in my own life.

I haven’t exactly been a perfect model of being present and reveling in my body. In fact, in my 20’s, I was a drug addict, binge drinker/eater, and smoker. I also repeatedly energetically left my body during times of trauma.

I’ve also experienced chronic illness and pain for most of my adult life; I’ve been bed-bound more than once and occasionally have to walk with a cane.

In the past 15+ years, I’ve done a lot of healing work around my relationship with food, drugs, and alcohol. I’ve been completely sober and a non-smoker for about that time and haven’t binged in over a decade.

And what that healing has shown me, loud and clear, is that the purpose of life is to be presentin the body.  With all the intense feelings and sensations that life brings. Including the ones that hurt like hell.

We aren’t here totranscendthe human experience. We aren’t here to rise above. Or try to “be spiritual.”

It isn’t that we can’t have transcendent experiences or that connecting with a “higher” perspective isn’t useful. But when we try tobethat, instead of what we are, we create suffering.

As Ram Dass would say, Be Here Now.

I think that is why I am so passionate about the message that knowing your Human Design means nothing if you don’t actually experiment and integrate what you discover. It’s why theHuman Design Map + Portalis abundant with resources to help you both learn AND embody.

Embodiment is where the magic happens! Every single time.

With each method of escape that I’ve let go of, that knowing only gets stronger and stronger.  And not just about Human Design – about everything.

Life really is happeningin the body.

I’m no longer blind to my urges to escape my body. I can see them clearly.

And when I am present with those urges, I know how to show up for myself. It’s a capacity that I have built over time. It didn’t happen overnight.

(I teach the “how” of that in theHuman Design Map)

As my capacity for being present in my body has grown, so has my success, my authenticity, my expression, my intuition, and my contribution. The body is where all of that wisdom lives.

Most recently, I’m focusing on being with physical pain and symptoms. To let them be instead of trying to fix them. Do what I can and let the rest be what it is.

To be fully human, it only works that way.

But if you are like me and you’ve experienced a metric fuck ton of trauma and escaping your body has been your only hope at survival, you can’t expect to just stop it all overnight. You just have to have compassion (human design gate 36), forgiveness (human design gate 4), and give yourself heaps and heaps of grace (human design gate 22).

It takes time to become present in your body.

But when you do, magic really does await because your body holds the wisdom.

Title: Human Design Gate 47 – Gene Key 47 – The A-Ha Moment Master￼
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 47 isThe Gate of Realization. But I call itThe A-Ha Moment Masterbecause its primary action is to trust in the divine timing of A-ha moments, insight, and clarity.

## About Human Design Gate 47 – Gene Key 47

Archetype Name:The A-Ha Moment Master

In Action:to trust that the a-ha moment is on it’s way

Keywords:insights, realizations, a-ha moments, and waiting for clarity

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 47

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 47 is the energy for trusting in the divine timing of a-ha moments, insights, and clarity. Gate 47 knows that you are not your mind, thoughts, or stories; you are pure consciousness.

With this knowing, Gate 47 lets thoughts come and go as if they were clouds floating through the sky. And, more importantly, gate 47 doesn’t chase a-ha moments; it makes plenty of space for clarity to come in Divine Timing.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 47 is the energy for obsessing about your thoughts and attaching meaning to them. When gate 47 becomes attached to thoughts or “finding” the a-ha moment, it can feel hopeless and a lot of unnecessary mental anguish.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling fearful,  doubtful or like a coward, but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 47 (Gene Key 47)

In my early thirties, I heard two axioms that changed the trajectory of my life…

Your thoughts create your reality.

AND

You are not your thoughts.

With my defined head and ajna, these ideas were nothing short of a holy revelation; they were indeed an a-ha moment.

For most of my life, I was very identified with my thoughts. I didn’t understand the sentences, stories, and conclusions inside my head were more like leaves on my river rather than being the river itself. And I had no idea that I had any sort of power over my thinking, either.

And true to mytranspersonal karma, learning that my thoughts and interpretations were “choices” set me onto a whole new path. And it is something that I will be forever grateful for.

The revelation of free-will is nothing short of miraculous.

But, I quickly learned that, in practice, there is a little more to it than “change  your thoughts to change your life.”

As with any axiom, cliche, or widely accepted piece of “wisdom” there is always a kernel of “truth.” But truth is subjective. And when we turn cliches into objective reality, and ignore the need for context, nuance, and empathy, things can quickly go south.

Without comprehension, on a very human level, axioms become impossible standards and measuring sticks of worthiness. They go from being empowering tools to being weapons that we use against ourselves and others.

That is exactly what happened to me when I sunk all of my energy into believing that my thoughts create my reality.

Yes, there was some truth for me there. But mostly, it was an inner war that I could never win. I commonly gaslighted myself (and probably others) into believing that things were great when they absolutely were not. I started to hate myself for having certain thoughts and I perpetuated the very same traumatic patterns that I was trying to heal.

I became insatiable on the quest for the rush of dopamine that came with the newest a-ha moment. A shift in a single thought could put me on a high for days.

And then, the inevitable crash.

Because I am human, my thoughts would seemingly “change back” and I’d be back to square one. But this time, with an all new layer of shame because “I knew better,”

In hindsight, and with my awareness of my Human Design, I can see a few things playing out here.

First, with my undefined solar plexus, I think I was actually unconsciously amplifying the emotional wave of people who had also become obsessed with “thought work.”

Probably more importantly, I was using those tools as a way to keep up in a neurotypical Generator world. I’d “change my thoughts” about feeling exhausted and I’d force myself to do things that I thought I “should” do.

Thankfully, by the mystery of Grace (human design gate 22), I started to recognize that changing my thoughts as a way of bypassing my emotions, glossing over trauma imprints, and ignoring my inner wisdom was causing way more harm than good.

And that by making space to just be with myself and trusting the alchemical process (which I teach inside theHuman Design Map), the a-ha moment really does always just come when we give it space.

By leaning into our inner wisdom and making space to energetically breathe, our perspective naturally changes. And it doesn’t mean that noticing where our thinking is creating harm isn’t a useful thing. Getting clear about the difference between facts and thoughts will forever be a mainstay in my toolbox.

But trying to force things ain’t it. Curiosity (human design gate 61), compassion (human design gate 36), and forgiveness (human design gate 4) are the true MVP’s here.

I encourage you to take some time with these questions. Take them out into your world and let their answers reveal themselves to you. ### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate48

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 48 is the energy for discovering the hidden layers and realms of what it means to be human. Gate 48 understands that you don’t become wise through education. You become wise through embodiment. With this understanding, it is empowered to explore the depths of life with curiosity and humility.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 48 is the energy for pursuing knowledge and education as a way to buffer from emotions. It can lead to over-preparing, overplanning, and feeling inadequate in what you know. At its worst, it can abuse positions of power where others are looking to you for depth of wisdom.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling like a book worm or avoidant but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 48 (Gene Key 48)

As I mentioned in my post abouthuman design gate 18, Gate 48 is defined in my conscious Pluto, which is conjunct with my conscious sun (human design gate 57).

I actually have the full channel of the wavelength (48-16) because gate 16 is defined in my conscious moon.

(I deep dive on all 36 channels inside theHuman Design Mapportal.)

## But before I get too deep on my experience with gate 48, let’s talk about general mechanics and how I interpret them…

### Pluto, Conscious Sun, Conjunction

Pluto is the place where we go through repeated rebirth in our lives – a place where our ego will die, again and again. Pluto takes us into the deepest shadows of our psyche and brings us out the other side with a new sense of integrity and wholeness.

In astrology, a conjunction is when two placements are in the same sign. There is some debate about how many degrees create a true conjunction – the most rigid definition being 10°.

When Pluto is conjunct with the sun, it brings a whole new level of intensity to the (astrology) chart because it “blends” with the life’s work of the conscious sun.

Because of the size of the sun and the density of its neutrino, the conscious sun is 70% of our energy.Everythinghappening in the chart is in service to the full expression of the conscious sun.

And conjunct Pluto, one would expect the full expression of their sun to include lots of (ego) death and rebirth. Pluto people, as they are often called, are alchemists to the core.

### Defined Channels

Defined channels are when both gates of a channel are defined.

When a channel is defined, we tend to have an easier time balancing the energies on each side of the channel and embody afuller spectrumfor them.

They correspond to the pathways in the Kabbalah Tree of Life.

### Kabbalah and Human Design

Kabbalah, Qabalah, and Cabalah are all based on the Tree of Life and I use them interchangeably to honor the various paths.

Kabbalah is the original system from the Jewish tradition, Qabalah is the Western Esoteric (aka Hermetic) path often called Ceremonial Magick or High Magick, and the Cabbala is a christian mystic path. Both Qabalah and Cabbala are rooted in Kabbalah.

All of these are spiritual paths that lead to what is called Enlightenment, Moksha, Self-Realization, a United Will, Completing The Great Work, Oneness, I AM Consciousness, Crystalline Consciousness, Christ Consciousness, and likely many others that I am either forgetting or just not aware of.

Kabbalah is one of the main systems that Human Design pulls from. In particular, there is correspondence between the 36 channels of the HD chart and the 32 pathways in the Tree of Life.

Which, I interpret that to mean that when we surrender to the voice of our magnetic monopole, we too are on the same path to enlightenment.

## Back to my gate 48…

My conscious sun (57), conjunct my conscious Pluto (48), and having the full 48-16 defined has been an interesting thing for me to contemplate. Particularly when I consider my experience of both learning and teaching

Other than the High Magick (which “works” the Kabbalah Tree of Life) and Alchemical Magick, Human Design is the only system that has held my interest enough to go really deep.

And, quite honestly, had it not been for my study of High Magick and Alchemy, I don’t think Human Design would have captured my heart the way it has.

In fact, I heard of Human Design about a decade before I looked more deeply into it. At that time in my life, I didn’t quite understand the value of “waiting” for anything.

But, after years of studing energy healing, magick, and Qabalah + a metric fuck ton of magickal synchronicities, I found my way back to Human Design.

The connection between the flow of the bodygraph and the Kabbalah (Qabalah) Tree of Life hit me like a lightning bolt. I saw the Human Design Chart in a whole new way.

Because of my understanding of the 32 paths of Qabalah, I thought, yep, that is how energy flows in the energy body.

As I started to study Human Design, I saw how truly practical it is when it is broken down into understandable parts. It was like it made Kabbalistic pathworking more “workable.”  And perspective has flowed into how I approach theHuman Design Map, too.

True to my pluto (48) conjunct sun (57), as I’ve gotten deeper and deeper into the Qabalah and Human Design, I’ve been able to step more into trusting my intuition and having many rebirths regarding my natural depth.

I long had a story that I was “too deep.” Making friends was a lifelong challenge because most people think I am “too intense.”

I often joke that if we aren’t talking about God within 5 minutes of meeting, we cannot be friends.

With Human Design in particular, I most recently realized that I had been holding back my depth of knowledge. I bought into the story that what I put out into the world needed to be easy to consume and that I needed to turn the dial down on my firehose.

But, of course, it is actually my depth that the people I am here to serve actually love. They don’t want me to hold back and stay on the surface. They want me to take it out as far into the ether as possible. And, of course, bring it back down for some practical know-how, when necessary.

Whether it is the conversations that happen inside themapportal or the deep dive series on my blog, it is the very thing that people love so much.

It is kind of funny now. I mean, seriously, Human Design is deep as fuck. I truly believe you could spend lifetimes studying it and experimenting with it and still only scratching the surface.

I’m not sure why I thought I needed to hold back. Human Design is the perfect place to “channel” that 48-16 energy.

Duh.

Content:

### TThe Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 49

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 49 is the energy for leading people through rocky times. Gate 49 deeply understands thatflowis the natural state of all energy – especially emotional energy – energy is meant to move at the right timing. The 49 has an emotional sense of when it’s time for a change, a renewal, and even a revolution.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 49 is the energy for believing that there is a right way and a wrong way to do life. Thiscausesthe 49 to become rigid and  “settle for nothing less” than perfect. From this place, it is common for the 49 to ruthlessly cut people out of their lives when they don’t live up to their perfect standards.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling ignorant, rebellious or intolerant, but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 49 (Gene Key 49)

Gate 49 (line 5) is in my unconscious moon, and…it’s been a journey. ;)

Our moon placements reveal how we relate to ourselves, our emotions, our intuition, and our inner wisdom.

The unconscious (red) side of the chart is symbolic of the parts of ourselves that we become conscious of over the course of our life. And often, they are the parts that we hide, reject, or banish in an attempt to be accepted by others (akashadow parts).

Besides the metric fuck ton of energy it takes to keep these parts of ourselves hidden (from ourselves), our shadows are actually the energies we need to leverage in order to have a full expression on the conscious (black) side of the chart.

In other words, if we maintain a “low” frequency on the unconscious side, the same will be true on the conscious side.

And despite what you’ve been told about your shadows, the answer isn’t to get rid of those parts; it is to love, value, and embrace them as essential parts of your higher purpose.

This is precisely what I’ve been doing with gate 49 in my unconscious moon.

(I’ll teach you “how” to love, value, and embrace your shadows inside the Human Design Map Portal.)

Some of the shadow words that could describe gate 49 are stubborn, intolerant, and rebellious. It is often referred to as “the murderer” or “the butcher” because it has a sharp knife and isn’t afraid to use it.

By doing my own shadow integration work, I have no shame in saying that I’ve been known to cut people out of my life due to my intolerance of their so-called imperfections. And I’ve ruthlessly burned bridges more times than I can count.

About a decade ago, I even concluded that my “toxic trait” was running when relationships got hard. It became a weapon I used against myself and a way to stay stuck in my “not good enough” story.

Somewhere along the way, I was conditioned to believe that a “truly healed person” would stay, no matter what. And with every relationship I ended, I hated myself more and more.

I thought that to grow and be an “evolved” person, I needed to learn how to stay, even when I was treated like hot garbage. I believed my role was to be a one-way emotional dumping ground. And that I should take it when people are utterly incapable ofowning their projections.

And “God” knows I tried. But I would inevitably reach my breaking point, and my spleen would scream a fiery NO.

Things came to a head when I spontaneously ended two significant relationships in less than a year.

The first was long overdue. It had always felt tough to stand up for myself and be clear about myboundaries. But on that fated day, I knew that it was time to end things for my emotional, mental, and spiritual well-being.

The second hit harder because it happened very suddenly. It turned out that they weren’t being authentic in our relationship. And hadn’t been for some time. I was hard on myself about not seeing through their inauthenticity; it opened old wounds around self-trust. And I felt ashamed that it was “yet another” relationship I no longer wanted to be in.

As I contemplated gate 49 in my unconscious moon, though, I realized that the problem wasn’t that I “always ran” when things got hard in a relationship.

The problem was that I was hard on myself for having boundaries, clear needs, and a spleen with no fucks left to give.

And while that energy was often expressed through stubbornness, intolerance, and rebellion, at the end of the day, it was me standing up for myself and my principles. I’m leading a personal revolution of authenticity, which can be messy AF.

(Which is why I offer the tools and support I do inside theHuman Design Map & Portal!)

And here is the key:

When I don’t…

…stand up for myself

…honor my boundaries

…show up authentically

I lose the connection I have with myself. My emotions get the best of me because I’m ignoring them. My intuitive spleen must ROAR because I’m not heeding the whispers.

By loving and owning this energy, my “running” instinct becomes a signal that something is off in my inner world. When I want to cut a bitch, it lets me know that I have needs, values, and boundaries that need tending.

With that awareness, I can take a step back, tune in, and see what is most authentic. By doing that, stubbornness, intolerance, and rebellion transform into wisdom, discernment, and revolution.

I’ve let go of the idea that staying in relationships that aren’t healthy is a badge of honor. Staying or going doesn’t prove anything, and I’ve forgiven myself for believing it does.

What I understand now is that being honest with ourselves is what matters most. Because that is the ONLY place we can be honest with others.

You can only stand in your Truth – about your needs, values, and boundaries – if you know your Truth.

That kind of self-leadership will lead to a revolution of authenticity in our relationships.

And I’m glad to be doing my part. Even if it looks like a hot fucking mess sometimes.

If you want to join me in the revolution by becoming a master at transforming your shadows into light,that is precisely what we’ll do inside the Human Design Map + Portal. I’ll see you there.

My principles lead the way.

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 50

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 50 is the energy for harmonizing the vibration of a group to a frequency that is rooted in the values and beliefs that will serve everyone. Gate 50 has an instinctive knowing that groups are only as healthy as each member and can easily spot fears that “corrupt” a group. With this awareness, it is able to determine the values that will serve it, the community and the collective.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 50 is the energy for staying in groups even though you can sense their “corrupt” nature. It may live out of fear, anger, and poor boundaries and is be easily persuaded into incorrect values and beliefs by unhealthy groups. This ultimately can lead to burnout and confusion.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling unaccountable, like a people pleaser or coward but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human DesignGate 50 (Gene Key 50)

Gate 50 is undefined in my chart but it does hold a special place in my heart.

The firstHuman Design MapI ever made was for someone with gate 50 in theirincarnation cross. I wrote about what a profound experience that was in my post ongate 15.

But, that aside, gate 50 has played a pretty significant role in my life because my conscious south node is also defined by its harmonic gate,human design gate 27.

Since I have passed my Uranus Opposition, I have shifted intogate 28being my nodal “petri dish.” (I explain the petri dish concept in my post ongate 48).

But, for most of my life, I have been deeply challenged in finding the balance between my needs and the needs of others.

There are lots of places in my chart that can point to that, havingtranspersonal karmabeing the main one. But, the chart aside, I think most women, especially of my age, were conditioned to sacrifice themselves for the sake of others.

So, whether it all comes down to gate 27 in my south node, I can’t say for sure.

What I can say, though, is that the thing that shifted my energy in gate 27 was knowing my values and aligning myself with them.

Inside theHuman Design Mapportal, I have a guide on defining your values. If you are amapclient, you can find thathere.

Some of my top values are integrity, intention, and clarity. With a mix of individual and collectivecircuitry, I also value individual and collective empowerment.

And nowhere in those values do I put myself at the bottom of the list. More importantly, I don’t surround myself with people who expect that from me.

I no longer believe that I was put on this earth to please others.

I started surrounding myself with people who understood that you can’t get water out of a dry well. I stopped being attached to what certain groups of people thought about me. And I let go of the idea that my value as a human being came from what I could do for others.

I can’t say that I always get the balance right. As I said before, I am a 5/2 profile which meansmy karma is transpersonal. So, on some level, I will always be balancing my need to serve others with my need to go within and be in my own flow. And deconditioning is about practice, not perfection.

(You’ll learn about your profile and karma in theHuman Design Map.)

But, for the most part, I do understand that honoring my needs + values and giving from the overflow is the way to go. And, I practice letting the chips fall where they may – by letting others think whatever they want about me.

And, I am starting to see that, as a karmic mirror for others (5/2), doing what is best for me and in alignment with my values is a powerful mirror to hold up.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 50

I live according to my values.

I know which groups are healthy and which ones aren’t.

I harmonize groups to a higher frequency.

### Now it’s your turn to contemplate Gate 50

When you stand in the truth that the gifts of gate 50 are always available to you (whether it’s defined in your chart or not)…

What do you value? (not sure? There is a bonus worksheet in theHuman Design Mapto walk you through defining your values.)

What do your values look like in action?

On a scale from 1 to 4, do you honor your values each day? 1 is not honoring your values at all and 4 is absolutely putting your values first.

How might the people you surround yourself with be influencing the way you show up for your values? Do you want to keep it that way? Or change it?

I encourage you to take some time with these questions. Take them out into your world and let their answers reveal themselves to you. Title: Human Design Gate 51 – Gene Key 51 – The Thunderbolt
Content:
The official name for Human Design Gate 51 isThe Gate of Shock. But I call itThe ThunderBoltbecause its primary action is to have radical faith in life and trust that each and every moment, even the most horrific ones, are gateways into divine love.

## About Human Design Gate 51 – Gene Key 51

Archetype Name:The Thunder Bolt

In Action:have radical faith in life and awaken through shock

Keywords:shock, awakening, being powerful, and Unconditional Love

Download All 64 Human Design Gates Cheatsheet (for free!)

Official Gate Name:Shock

Human Design Definition:The ability to respond to disorder and shock through recognition and adaptation.

Core Theme:To be first at something.

Bodygraph Center:Will center and connects to the G center viahuman design gate 25.

Tropical Sign:Aries

Gene Keys Shadow:Agitation

Gene Keys Gift:Initiative

Gene Keys Siddhi:Awakening

(Want all of the correspondences and keynotes for the gates of your incarnation cross? TheHuman Design Mapis for you.)

### The Positive and Negative Sides of Human Design Gate 51

All energy in theHuman Design chart exists on a spectrum of potential.

On the “positive” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 51 is the energy for Initiating awakening through the shock of unconditional love. In its highest frequency, gate 51 believes life is trustworthybecause ofit’s curveballs (rather than in spite of them) and practices radical faith that every moment, even the most horrific ones, are gateways into Divine Love.

On the “negative” end of the spectrum, Human Design Gate 51 is the energy for using shock to hurt others, pushing people’s buttons, and deeply traumatic life experiences. These are all indicators of losing faith in life/the Divine and ignoring the calls to awaken.

You’ll learn about the surprising (but most effective) way to raise your energy frequency in theHuman Design Map + Portal.

In the meantime, start noticing when you are feeling faithless, trustless or shocked but don’t be an asshole to yourself. Treat yourself the way you would a small child – with love, curiosity, and understanding.

### My Personal Experience with Human Design Gate 51 (Gene Key 51)

I have gate 51 (line 5) in the conscious earth of myincarnation cross.

And to say that I know the energy of Gate 51 really well would be the understatement of the century.

I once had a therapist tell me that people with stories like mine jump off bridges. An astrologer told me that they’d need a stiff drink to read my chart. And an “Intuitive Human Design Expert” told me that I should just call it quits, collect unemployment, and play video games for the rest of my life.

As a child, I witnessed things you wouldn’t wish on your worst enemy. I’ve experienced things no human should have to experience. And I often feel like I’ve lived hundreds of lifetimes in this one incarnation.

I could truly go on for days about the various shocks I’ve experienced. That isn’t to say that I’ve had a “worse” life than anyone else. I don’t really find those types of judgments useful.

But, I do share it to demonstrate that working WITH the energy we actually have, instead of using it against ourselves, is the greatest contribution we can make to the world.

It took me many, many years to understand that, and it is what I teach myHuman Design Mapclients every single day.

For the first part of my life, I didn’t know how to deal with the shock and trauma. And, like so many in my generation, no one helped me process my experiences in a healthy way, and I was often dismissed as being “too sensitive” or “dramatic.”

By high school, I had developed an eating disorder, and by my mid-twenties I was strung out on drugs.

The pain was too much to bear.

That began to change during my first Saturn Return.

One of my brothers, Ronnie, died in a car accident at the age of 25. My other brother, Bryan, has since unexpectedly died as well.

Both were powerful spiritual awakenings in my life.

But when Ronnie died, the sheer shock of it cracked me open in a way that I can’t explain.

It is like I finally surrendered to the beautiful disaster of life on Earth.

Suddenly, I had a deep understanding that life will always be full of plot twists and that I can either keep using them against me or for me.

I wouldn’t have said it quite that way at the time. I’m not even sure I would have seen it as such a pivotal time in my life.

But my life was never the same after it.

By my early 30s, I was in much-needed therapy, recovering from the eating disorders, completely sober, in a healthy relationship with my husband, and starting my business.

It was a winding road, of course, and I learned a metric fuck ton along the way.

I went on to become a master energy healer and coach. I developed my signature energy healing method and eventually surrendered to the call to teach others about their Human Design.

(I teach my signature healing method, called the MAP Method for Deconditioning, inside theHuman Design Mapportal.)

As gate 51 shows us, I let the shocks wake me up.

But, of course, awakening is an ongoing process. After we integrate one thing, a new layer is revealed, and that is precisely what happened when I was 36.

I “accidentally” learned that the man I call dad isn’t my biological father.

My parents had kept this secret from me and never intended to tell me the truth. The pain was complex and profound. I felt relieved, angry, hurt, and confused.

The way I experienced the shock was utterly different, though.

It hurt like hell, but I immediately understood it was for my awakening. I knew that I would emerge from it with a more embodied experience of Grace, forgiveness, and gratitude.

True to my design, I was stable and grounded by the shock. I know that sounds like a paradox. But it is 100% true.

It is a paradox because we often believe that shock must equal suffering.

But, like all beliefs, seeing life that way is optional.

I now realize that spiritual awakening requires shock.

Shock cracks our hearts wide open so that we can receive the wealth of unconditional love (gate 25).

Even in our deepest suffering, even in the face of our ugliest shadows, and even when we can’t wrap our minds around whatever is happening.

It is always happeningforus, nottous.

And there is nothing more beautiful than that. When you are ready to have your heart cracked wide open, purchase yourHuman Design Mapand then take the journey in the portal. Let it shock you.

## Affirmations for Human Design Gate 51

Using your Human Design to create affirmations is a powerful way to activate the full potential of your chart. Here are some affirmations for Gate 51:

I have radical faith in life.

Every experience in life is an opportunity to awaken.

I have the courage to live according to my inner guidance.
